Meditation has been practiced for centuries, and numerous studies have documented the positive effects on mental health. The benefits of daily meditation practice for mental health include:

1. Reducing stress and anxiety: Meditation helps to calm the mind and reduces stress and anxiety levels.

2. Improving focus and attention: Research suggests that meditation can improve focus and attention, helping to increase productivity and performance.

3. Improving self-awareness: Meditation promotes self-awareness and helps to increase emotional intelligence, improving the ability to regulate emotions.

4. Boosting positivity: Meditation can enhance positive emotions and help to reduce negative thoughts and feelings.

5. Enhancing resilience: Regular meditation practice can make people more resilient to stress, helping them to cope with difficult situations better.

6. Reducing symptoms of depression: Studies have shown that meditation can help to reduce the symptoms of depression, such as low mood and lack of energy.

Overall, daily meditation practice can benefit mental health and well-being, helping to create a sense of calmness and inner peace in individuals.
